conclusion: Determine the refraction angle when the light enters the Dawes prism and whether the light can exit from edge CD using Snell's law and the properties of the prism.
The light is emitted from point M and is parallel to the base CD.
The angle of incidence at AC is 45 degrees.
The refractive index of the prism glass is n = sqrt(2).
Using Snell's law, 1 * sin(45 degrees) = sqrt(2) * sin(theta_2).
Solving for sin(theta_2), we get sin(theta_2) = 1/2.
The angle of incidence at CD is 135 degrees.
Using Snell's law for the exit, sin(theta_3) = sqrt(2) * sin(theta_4).
Since sin(theta_3) > 1, total internal reflection occurs at the exit face CD.
The light cannot exit from edge CD.
